info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 7:18PM EDT until July 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Schenectady County in east central New York... Southwestern Saratoga County in east central New York... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 718 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Galway, or 9 miles east of Amsterdam, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Saratoga Springs, Scotia, Glenville, Niskayuna, Ballston Spa, Round Lake, Country Knolls, North Ballston Spa, Rotterdam Junction, Alplaus, East Glenville, Burnt Hills, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Malta, Charlton, Princetown and Glenridge. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
